intro: Docynia longiunguis, commonly known as the long-fruited golden berry, is a species of flowering plant in the family Solanaceae. It is native to Central and South America and is characterized by its yellow-orange, fleshy berries that are edible when ripe. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are simple, alternate, and ovate with a slightly hairy surface. The flowers are small, white or pale yellow, and clustered in umbels, which attract various pollinators.
